paragraph: Mara Petrova (Bulgarian: Мара Петрова) (1921–1997) was a Bulgarian pianist, writer and composer born in Sliven, Bulgaria. She studied composition at the State Academy of Music with Vesselin Stoyanov, piano with Pancho Vladigerov, and choral conducting with Marin Goleminov. After completing her studies, she took a position teaching at the Institute for Music and Choreographic Specialists. Petrova also published articles on music and worked as a composer.
Petrova composed for theater, orchestra, chamber ensemble, instruments and choir. Selected works include:
Youth Suite for strings and timpani
Triptych for voice, strings and small drum
The Blue-Eyed Girl for voice and string orchestra
Lullaby for voice and string orchestra
Sofia Suite for oboe, clarinet, bassoon and small drum
Song and Scherzo for flute and piano
Poem for my Native Town choral
